intro: Promenaea stapelioides nothosubsp. nigricans, commonly known as the Black Nightshade Promenaea, is a unique hybrid plant with distinctive botanical features. It belongs to the Apocynaceae family and is characterized by its dark, almost black, velvety leaves that give it its common name. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically greenish-white in color, which contrast with its dark foliage. It is native to South America and is often cultivated for its ornamental value due to its striking appearance. This nothosubspecies exhibits traits that make it a fascinating subject for botanical study and horticultural interest.
